I

IconHolder() - Constructor for class org.hermann.media.Icons.IconHolder
 
Icons - Class in org.hermann.media
I'm not sure what's the best way to import the chess piece images into my project, but I think it's a good idea to create a separate class for them like Adrian did.
Icons() - Constructor for class org.hermann.media.Icons
In out constructor we just read in the image streams and put them into our attributes, we have to think about what to do if the images are not found, since a game without visible chess pieces on the board is pretty hard to play.
Icons.IconHolder - Class in org.hermann.media
So there's our private static class Icon holder which holds a static instance of Icons
initializeContent() - Method in class org.hermann.view.BoardSquares
In this method we initialize the 8 by 8 grid of buttons and add our BoardSquaresMouseListener to every button, we also set the squares' background according to the colors of a chess board.
initializeContent() - Method in class org.hermann.view.MenuPanel
Initializes the buttons and labels, we don't use a layout manager, so set the bounds by hand
initializeWindow(int) - Method in class org.hermann.view.BoardSquares
Initializing the board squares making it rectangular and centering it below the MenuPanel.
initializeWindow() - Method in class org.hermann.view.ChessGUI
We initialize the window and set its dimension to SCREEN_SIZE this is important for the BoardSquares, because it adapts to this dimension.
initializeWindow(int, int) - Method in class org.hermann.view.MenuPanel
This initializes the window and sets the size according to the given value
INSTANCE - Static variable in class org.hermann.media.Icons.IconHolder
 
isAiEnabled() - Static method in class org.hermann.controller.ChessStatics
 
isGameOver(Board) - Static method in class org.hermann.controller.ChessStatics
This method should be executed every time a successful move has been made.
isKingInCheck(char) - Method in class org.hermann.model.board.Board
So this method is apparently one of the major issues during any chess game development and I was stuck for quite some time figuring out a way to to tell whether the current player's King is in check or not.
isMoveValid(Board, char, int[], int[]) - Method in class org.hermann.model.pieces.Bishop
The bishops movement is a little tricky, I think the easiest solution would be to take the number of fields the Piece moves into a direction (in this case the x-component) and compare it to the movement into the y direction they have to match in order to make a valid move.
isMoveValid(Board, char, int[], int[]) - Method in class org.hermann.model.pieces.King
The validity of the kings movement in general should be a little easier to check than with the other Pieces, we only have to make sure that he moves exactly one field into any direction (provided that the field is either empty or occupied by another players piece) I'm not sure if I'll be able to implement the castling move, which would make everything way more complicated. => I did, and it was annoying and complicated, because there are just so many rules to it and there's no easy way to generalize the movement pattern while castling
isMoveValid(Board, char, int[], int[]) - Method in class org.hermann.model.pieces.Knight
The Knights movement pattern in general is a little weird, but it should actually be easier to implement since he can just jump over other pieces and we don't have to check the fields in his way.
isMoveValid(Board, char, int[], int[]) - Method in class org.hermann.model.pieces.Pawn
We need a function to tell whether a move is valid or not, a boolean value will be returned.
isMoveValid(Board, char, int[], int[]) - Method in class org.hermann.model.pieces.Piece
Every piece needs a method to verify a move
isMoveValid(Board, char, int[], int[]) - Method in class org.hermann.model.pieces.Queen
Since the Queen is allowed to do both rook and bishop movement it would be the easiest to simply copy their codes, it doesn't look too nice, but it works.
isMoveValid(Board, char, int[], int[]) - Method in class org.hermann.model.pieces.Rook
The rooks movement is pretty straight forward (no pun intended), although it will be annoying to test, if the fields he crosses towards his destination are empty
isPlayerProperty(char) - Method in class org.hermann.model.pieces.Piece
Important for every piece, players should only be able to move their own pieces, the method is to be used in/before the isValidMove-methods...
